storyInfo: The party discovers unexpected danger in the tunnel at the other shore—a vein of active Originium could soon destroy Zeruertza. As they argue, Gavial raises the possibility of refuge on the surface.

attributes.content: Stitch opens his eyes, and sees two familiar figures.
Avdotya, I've got your fresh change of clothes here.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Also, Croque, drink a little less in future, to be on the safe side.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Ahahah, sorry, sorry. All's well that ends well, though, wouldn't you say?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: No, I still don't see anything 'well' about this...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: In the meantime, I suppose I'll find somewhere to change.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: With that, the two of them notice Stitch has come to.
*sigh* Good morning, Stitch.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: What happened to me?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Do you still remember how you fainted?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I was steering the boat, and then old Edge came running over, and then... oof, my head...
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: And then the boat went out of control, crashed against the shore, and flung the two of you out.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And how about Master Edge?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: He woke up before you, and he's taken Elysium with him to survey for now.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Wait, the gear on the boat!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: The equipment's all essentially wrecked. As for the survey gear... we had Deculture make that on the fly.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: The cutting equipment won't be necessary, though.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: You didn't notice the terribly loud noise ever since you woke up?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Avdotya flashes a begrudging glance at a place too not far off.
And with her prompting, it finally hits Stitch that the persistent racket isn't just nature. Is that a mixture of a chainsaw's roar and collapsing rock?
Gavial, what in your right mind are you doing...?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Looks obvious to me. I'm sorting out this cliff face.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The boat did put a considerable dent in the caved-in area, but clearing a passage was never going to be that simple.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And with our cutting equipment down, I thought we'd be waiting for a while, but it turns out—
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Well, seeing is believing.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: HAHA! Forget rail repairs and surveys, any bozo can tell THIS is my strong suit!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gazing all around, Stitch sees numerous fragments of extremely orderly cut rock, as well as a tunnel wide enough to fit two side by side.
The fine work of Gavial, without a doubt.
Which is to say, deprived of all the cutting equipment, Gavial opened a way through to the tunnel all by her singular self.
Stitch can't help but begin to suspect that the rumors he heard from the Acahuallan tribes, all those legends of the invincible Gavial, were at least partly founded in reality.
Oh, hey, Elysium. How come you're back so soon?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What happened? Where's Master Edge?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Things have gone a little south, Gavial.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Huh? You mean some giant Originium slug showed up, or what? I heard Provence saw something like that in Siesta.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If it was just some creature, I guarantee I'd be happy to wisecrack with you right now.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Follow me.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: After having drilled through the cave-in, everyone enters the tunnel itself.
The space inside is more of a cave than a tunnel in reality, both vast and profoundly deep.
Nevertheless, Elysium is more than up to the task, and everyone proceeds through smoothly with him leading the way.
So smoothly, in fact, that it piques their curiosities that he could grasp the tunnel's structure in such a short time; there's even suspicion he's been this way before.
However, that idea, more a joke than anything, pales in comparison to the hesitance at the sight that greets them where Elysium comes to a halt.
It is a vein of Originium, exposed on the surface of the strata.
Moreover, anyone with some knowledge of Originium could easily tell that this vein has been active for a very, very long time.
And activity means—
Explosion.
Or put less kindly—
Disaster.
How can this be?!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: We'd detected the presence of Originium veins in this direction back in the city's founding times, but they should've been much further out—
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Is there any chance the earthquake pulled them here? I heard about a few small aftershocks in the wake.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: The suddenness of this vein definitely matches, after all.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: It's not impossible...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Right, that's it! Chances are that earthquake shifted it right over here!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: And what's more, it gave it that push, got its activity slowly warming up.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: And because the dome's Originium sensor facilities have been down all this time, that's why we only just now found this out—
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Stitch, calm now. This isn't your fault.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: We made this decision as the collective inhabitants of Zeruertza.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Thing's just...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: We haven't gone even a half kilometer from outside, I'd wager. If a full vein of active Originium explodes only that deep in...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Then Zeruertza's out of luck.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Attention all residents of Zeruertza, we interrupt this broadcast with an urgent notice.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Following the conclusion of our swimming competition prior, Master Edge has taken the initiative in leading a selection of other contestants through the cave-in to survey the tunnel.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: The results of this survey are not optimistic.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Master Edge has discovered an Originium vein in the tunnel, located approximately one kilometer from the city.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: We tentatively speculate this Originium vein's existence was known at the time of Zeruertza's founding, in a stratum approximately three kilometers out.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: However, tectonic shift originating in the earthquake half a year ago caused this vein to warp and extend closer to our city, and kickstarted its activation in the process.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Currently, Master Edge is leading experts to urgently evaluate this Originium vein's level of activity, and thus determine at what point in the future it will explode.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: We will provide further updates once accurate conclusions can be drawn.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: As of now, we ask all residents to be prepared to evacuate.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Huh? An active Originium vein's going to explode? Where's this coming from?
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: Judging by the broadcast, we never picked it up after the earthquake wrecked the dome, since the Originium sensor functions never got fixed since.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: Now that you mention, I'm pretty sure I've heard Master Edge make mention of the sort.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: Well, nothing to do about it now, such as it is.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: Don't you... feel as though it was a poor decision to build 'The Great Aquapit?'
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What for? It's an outcome we're willing to take.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: True, that. We've never rejected any of the naysay from Master Edge.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: He warned as much when we decided to build this 'Great Aquapit' instead of repairing that hole in the dome.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: And we only made that decision once we understood and accepted the potential danger.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: All it is now is taking responsibility for the outcome of our choice.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: So it is, surface-dweller. You don't need to give us any pity.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: Think about it this way: we've spent a good long summer at least, haven't we?
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: I completely agree.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: Though, evacuating, eh... Haven't decided what I'm going to leave behind. Have you?
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: I'm nothing like you are. If you ask me right now, my house here's my most wanted and most satisfying design yet.
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: That's fair. I hope that Originium vein's not going off too easily. I still need to think a little.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: How about we go for a drink for now? Some Old Karl Mead?
attributes.name: Cool-Headed Durin

attributes.content: Not my poison. I'll rather be having a No. 7 Whiskey.
attributes.name: Indolent Durin

attributes.content: I'd taken Durins to all be buffoons barely smarter than the Archosauria above them... It seems that was hardly the case.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: What's the outlook, Master Edge?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: We'll need a little more time to be sure, but based on my experience—
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: It'll go off within a month.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: A month?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Then we should lay the railway while we have the chance, and arrange to evacuate the residents through the tunnel.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Not a chance. Not enough time.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Much more feasible if we dig a temporary shelter deeper in.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: We're all aware the dome might be able to suppress some of the vein's explosive force, should it go off.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But the real issue is the Originium dust scattering afterwards!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Once it happens, that dust will fill this entire space, and all of us will be affected by it!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: We have to repair the railway despite any danger at this point, and then we clear any obstructions and have everyone take refuge in Ortzimuga!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But the tunnel's already wall to wall with Originium now! It'll be a nightmare to pass through safely!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Zeruertza's home to hundreds of thousands! Do you not understand how much time it'll take to feed them carefully through that tunnel? It's two by two at most in there, you realize that?!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Hey... cool the quibbling.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial, I'll get to you in a moment. Master Edge, do you honestly have a better plan?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I believe we should begin immediately digging away from the Originium vein.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: We dig a small-scale shelter, big enough to hold everyone, then we seal off the way to it. It's just a question of digging deep enough...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: It'll be a harrowing feat to construct a shelter for hundreds of thousands in this short a time, even with all the technology Zeruertza has.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And besides, that's hundreds of thousands of lives to support! What do you propose there?!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And you think waltzing through the tunnel solves that?!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: At least there'll be leeway to begin to do so, provided we pass the most dangerous part of the vein!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But if we stay in a temporary shelter, then consider what happens once the Originium seals off our singular passage to any other city.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: We'll have nothing to look forward to but a drawn-out death!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Ugh, I can see your point there, but I still believe...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Of course I understand the risk in my argument! But it's the least worst option we have now!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Y'know... Avdotya.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If it's not important, can you hold your peace for now, Gavial?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Don't really want to disturb you guys either, but—
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Seeing as the tunnel's blocked...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Our only option left is to fix that Super Convenient Lift-o-Matic #1 Tomimi mentioned, bring all the Durins to the surface and let 'em live with our tribes for a while, right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I mean, anything wrong with that idea? You guys have been arguing over this forever.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We head for the... surface?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Uh, guys... did you never consider that before?
attributes.name: Gavial
